ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: 1The readings were minimal but the ones I did read were great and mostly anecdotal stories rather than academic, which was a nice change of pace.2,3,4--The workload was very reasonable and perfect for the course expectations. it mostly involved field trip preparation, one presentation, and weekly lecture responses. These assignments/projects were very useful since they literally helped the class move forward. This also helped the pace move properly. Having a small class was perfect because everyone was equally involved and had time to pursue a topic of their choice and present it5,6,7--THE FIELD TRIPS WERE FANTASTIC!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!8,9,10--Chad was great in the class. Compared with other courses he teaches this is where he really shines! This course and his teaching it are very valuable!

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The field trips and the harmony within the group.
Great that this class is like a conversation instead of a lecture. The field trips are great. Chad is also very flexible and cares that the students learn and have a good experience.

THE FIELD TRIPS!!!!!!!!! Us students got to completely plan it and determine who we would meet with. It was wonderful!I also enjoyed having a small number of students rather than large because it was more intimate and independent overall!

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Students should do more to share their contacts for the field trips.

The first few weeks were a bit pointless and unorganized, which made it a bit of a wasted opportunity. But once the class got rolling things were great!We didn't really pursue Roberts Rules of Order which would have been a great addition to what I got out of the class.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I highly recommend it! The field trips, small number of students, and student presentations made the entire course very worthwhile!

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: General interest in improving my leadership skills.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes and No--students planning the field trips was valuable but I was hoping to learn more about running a meeting and Roberts Rules of Order

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Advantage - organized two great field trips to meet with professionals in our field.Disadvantage - communication was occasionally challenging.
Great! Problem solving and communication are key

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Approach the instructor with your suggestions/ wishes/ comments! He is very open to that, so you have a lot of freedom to design the course along your interests!
Share your professional contacts to visit!
Take it and enjoy the field trips!
